notes: Range: 30’ or more -- Duration: 1 round or longer -- Casting time: 1 round -- Save: Will save vs. spell check DC
general: This spell causes its victim to experience abject terror, potentially fleeing the scene or cowering in fright. The spell does not affect automatons, golems, mindless un-dead (such as zombies or skeletons), and other creatures that do not feel fear.

table.1: caster’s visage transforms into something horrible
table.2: target’s worst nightmare appears before its eyes for a brief instant
table.3: nothing visual occurs but unreasoning fear grips target
table.4: an image of a terrible monster momentarily flashes into existence then disappears

table.1: the caster develops an irrational fear related to (1) chickens, (2) horses, (3) rocks, (4) clouds, (5) apples, (6) snakes, such that he must flee in fear if he fails a DC 10 Will save whenever he sees such a creature or object
table.2: the caster is especially susceptible to fear, receiving a -2 penalty to saves to resist it from now on
table.3: caster’s face changes to resemble the monster that he fears most

table.1: nearest ally is absolutely terrified and must make DC 12 Will save or run in fear for 1d4+1 rounds
table.2: caster’s visage is momentarily transformed into something absolutely horrid, frightening his familiar, which runs away for 24 hours

table.2-11: Failure, but spell is not lost.
table.12-13: The caster can target one creature within 30’ and line of sight. That creature receives a Will save to resist the effect. Failure indicates it experiences a moment of fright. It immediately flees the area at maximum speed. The scare lasts only one round; on the round following the failed save, the creature recovers its wits.
table.14-15: The caster can target one creature within 30’ and line of sight. That creature receives a Will save to resist the effect. Failure indicates it experiences a moment of fright. It immediately flees the area at maximum speed. The scare lasts 1d4+1 rounds.
table.16-19: The caster can target one creature within 30’ and line of sight. That creature receives a Will save to resist the effect. Failure indicates it experiences a moment of fright. It immediately flees the area at maximum speed. The scare lasts 1d4+1 rounds.
table.20-21: The caster can target two creatures within 60’ and line of sight. Those creatures receive a Will save to resist the effect. Failure indicates they experience a moment of fright. They immediately flee the area at maximum speed. The scare lasts 1d6+1 rounds.
table.22-25: The caster can frighten three enemies within 60’. They receive a Will save to resist the effect. Failure indicates they experience a moment of fright. They immediately flee the area at maximum speed. The scare lasts 1d6+1 rounds.
table.26-29: The caster can frighten all enemies within 60’. Creatures of 1 HD or less are automatically frightened; others receive a Will save to resist the effect. Failure indicates they experience a moment of fright. They immediately flee the area at maximum speed. The scare lasts 1d6+1 rounds.

table.34+: The caster can frighten all enemies within 120’. Creatures of 3 HD or less are automatically frightened; others receive a Will save to resist the effect.
